availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lebanon, Kentucky, commonwealth's attorney. Paris, Maine, native. Son of Daniel Noble and Hannah Knight Noble. Married to Anne Alice Hogue Noble. Father of Mary C. Noble, William P. Noble, Charles H. Noble, and Daniel A. Noble. Graduated from Harvard University in 1847. Resident of St. Louis, Missouri from 1847 to 1848. Operated a drugstore in Lebanon from 1848 to 1849. Attorney in Lebanon from 1849 to 1872. Commonwealth's attorney for the Fifth Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1862 to 1867.

ab.bibl:

“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 9-12.
